overview_of_class: The purpose of this seminar is to provide structure and support for students in the Sound Arts and Industries program toward the completion of their Study in Sound. This is accomplished through a participatory format of presentation, discussion, and critique supporting the formulation and incremental refinement of each student's capstone project. This process will culminate in the final presentation of Study in Sound, in whatever format best suits the work accomplished.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: The learning objectives of the course will be determined by each student, as they pertain to their individual goals.

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value:
Students will be evaluated on the basis of:

  • their proposal of, and adherence to, a plan of work for the quarter

  • 4-5 presentations over the course of the quarter.

  • participation in class discussion and critiques.

name: Topics in Sound Production
title: SoC SAI 401-0-22 Topics in Sound Production

descriptions.name: Overview of class
descriptions.value: This course is a seminar on sound in Animation. Students will be required to make several short soundtracks for various animated films, that reflects the techniques we are studying.

descriptions.name: Learning Objectives
descriptions.value: Students should have a good idea of the relationship between sound and image in a variety of animation contexts. They should feel confident in analyzing tracks, lip sync, underscoring, Foley, and the dominant conventions that drive sound in animation.

descriptions.name: Teaching Method
descriptions.value: Case studiesClass participationDemonstrationsDiscussionDiscussion sectionField tripsFilms / videosGuest speakersLectureObservationProblem setsResearch project

descriptions.name: Evaluation Method
descriptions.value: Class participationDemonstrationsField workFilms / videosHomeworkProblem setsProject, final

descriptions.name: Class Materials (Required)
descriptions.value: Materials required will be based on student needs for their soundtrack, but will primarily involve Foley work.
